definition: (of plants) to turn green again/to revegetate
abbr. for 青海[Qing1 hai3], Qinghai Province

sentences.english: Happily a good rain followed, turning the maize leaves green again.
sentences.chinese: 幸好接着下了一場好雨，使玉米葉子又返青了。

sentences.english: But the quality of cross-section affects the rate of returning green direct.
sentences.chinese: 然而平茬斷面質量的好壞，直接影響檸條的返青率。

sentences.english: Fields, green a boundless hope, as if the green wave.
sentences.chinese: 田野上，麥苗返青，一望無邊，彷彿綠色的波浪。

sentences.english: Besides, the variation of evaporation from soil as related to leaf area index has also been calculated and analyzed.
sentences.chinese: 並分析了返青后土壤蒸發隨葉面積指數變化的規律。

sentences.english: The flowers are blooming, the trees are growing and the grass is turning green.
sentences.chinese: 盛開的鮮花，越來越多的樹木和草返青。

sentences.english: Spring coming on, the trees turned green.
Besides, the variation of evaporation from soil as related to leaf area index …
sentences.chinese: 並分析了返青后土壤蒸發隨葉面積指數變化的規律。

definition: tiller (stem at the base of grass plants)
to sprout/to come out (of seedling)/to bud
the embryonic development of grain while still on the stem
to have the ears of grain come up
cotton boll splits open and reveals its white interior
the state of moisture in the soil (and whether it can support a crop)
